description: How do macroscopic variables (e.g. energy, pressure) develop through the collision or
interaction of microscopic objects? Why is the spread of disease in an orchard similar to a
piece of iron becoming magnetized? Students study classical and quantum gases, followed by
magnets and phase transitions (Ising Model, percolation, renormalization) and employ both
analytical and computer methods (Monte-Carlo sampling, simulations, molecular dynamics).
